title: Gaming and Q/A with the Angular Team | July 2022
desc: Mark and Jeremy are back with another stream with a very special guest

title: Getting Started with Angular Material - Advancio Tech Webinar
desc: On this course, we will go over the necessary steps to set up and review the main features of the #Angular Material library. You will also learn how to include a diverse set of components and theming configurations for your project. We have a live exercise where we will show you how to install the Angular Material library on an Angular Project.

title: AngularAir - So, about that inject function in Angular v14
desc: With the release of Angular v14 we are now able to use the inject() function in a lot more places, opening the door for things like creating functions that utilize providers retrieved from the injection provider. In this episode we discuss this new-found world of opportunity and the potential pros and cons of what it might mean to our Angular development experience.

title: How to make Angular applications more robust
desc: In our day to day work we tend to skip and short cut some paths to save time for ourselves or make it easier, but eventually it back fires as careless approach leads to an increased amount of bugs in the production, higher maintenance costs, harder features incorporation and so on.

title: Reload current route in Angular
desc: In Angular apps there is often a need to refresh current page being on the same route. For example, the common use case for that is the data reloading of the active components after login.

title: API endpoint parameter handling within an Angular 13 application
desc: Handling many API endpoints with even more parameters can be challenging. I asked myself a few questions on how I could make the implementations as clean as possible: ...

title: Angular 13 Tutorial - 6 - Passing Data from Parent to Child Component
desc: This video contains how to create parent-child components and how to pass data from parent to its child component

title: Building Autocomplete Search Component from Scratch: Angular
desc:
In this article, you'll learn how to implement your own autocomplete component using Angular and RxJS. For the demo, I'll pass an array to the suggestion options. You can also get the options from an HTTP request through API. You have a choice for the options shown. Just fetch the options and store them into an array.
(photo: by Safar Safarov on Unsplash)

title: Get to Know the 2022 ng-conf Speakers | Michael Dowden | ng-conf 2022
Make Pretty / User-Friendly Charts with Angular 14 & ng2-charts v3.1.0
desc: In this post, we'll create a line chart (in Angular 14 with the latest release of ng2-charts) in a style that's all the rage in cryptocurrency dashboard design (RIP) and optimized for user interaction.

title: Angular Team Meetup June 2022 - Creating and Using ESLint Rules
desc: An archive of our June 2022 Angular Team Meetup Twitch Stream. Jonathan Spickerman talks about 'Painless Migration from TSLint to ESLint', Wade Harkins goes over enforcing accessibility practices in Angular templates using ESLint rules, and Fábio Englert Moutinho walks us through creating custom ESLint rules!

title: WebStorm's Power User Manual: Angular Edition
desc: Have you ever felt that you could do more with your Angular projects in WebStorm, but didn't know where to start? If so, we have the webinar for you!

title: Angular Route Parameters: A Simple Guide
desc:
An overview of Angular route parameters.
Routing is one of the fundamental mechanisms in Angular. Its primary use is to provide a way to navigate through an application. Without it, we would be stuck on the same page forever!
(photo: by author)

title: How to Inject Angular Services in External JavaScript Functions, and Component's Static Functions
desc: As your enterprise application starts growing, you come to the point where you have one or many external JavaScript functions from 3rd party libraries, some static functions/classes. The situation becomes interesting when you have to pass data to these functions from the @Injectable() services. In this story, we will try to solve them.

title: Angular Unit Testing
desc: By executing a piece of automated code that calls a unit of work, unit testing ensures that your application functions as intended (a separate piece of code). Based on a presumption about how that unit of labor would behave, the test will either pass or fail (we call this the code under test).

title: Welcome to pl-schematics
desc: Do you want to create an Angular package, but you don't care about the core application part and do you want to be ready immediately for the creation of graphical interfaces? pl-schematics can help you with this.

title: Parent Child Data Transfer in Angular
desc: Angular Parent Child Data Transfer and Nested Components

title: Angular Standalone Components
desc: The Standalone Components have been released in Angular 14. It's a way to create an application with less boilerplate code (meaning, the ngModules), and also have the option to lazy load the components.

title: Angular Standalone components | Create inject standalone components | Angular 14 updates
desc: In this video we will learn how to create Angular 14 standalone application without using ngModules. We will learn whats new in Angular 14 command line interface.

title: What is new with Angular 14: 9+ features
desc:
One of Google's outstanding development tools is Angular, a typescript-based web application framework for building client-side enterprise mobile and web apps. It has been upgraded to Angular 14, its most recent version.
In this article, we'll go over what Angular 14 includes in terms of upgrades and features. Let's get started with the new features built into Angular 14.
(photo: by Tudor Baciu on Unsplash)

title: Get to Know the 2022 ng-conf Speakers | Alisa Duncan | ng-conf 2022
S3 E15 - AWS & Infrastructure As Code
desc: Do you know how infrastructure-as-code fits into your developer toolbelt? In this episode, David Tucker distills his incredible knowledge of AWS/serverless to make this vast topic accessible to developers of all levels

title: How to create an RxJS Observable - manually and by use of Creation Operators
desc:
Reactive programming is somewhat of a shift in thinking on how you get values from a source of data. Instead of you asking the source every few seconds for an update, the source sends you data you are interested in over time. In other words, we are talking about a stream of data that comes to you over time.
In this first article (in my RxJS series), I want to focus on how to create such a data source.
(photo: by qi xna on Unsplash)

title: Why Your Angular Bundle Is Bloated
desc: A common reason why an Angular bundle is bloated is that it uses a library like MomentJS that isn't tree-shakable. This blog post will go over how to analyze your Angular bundle and pinpoint libraries that are bloating your application.

title: Test Driven Development Angular Typescript Introduction by Scott Hammer
Angular Release: v14.1.0-next.3
Angular Release: v14.0.4
New Features in Angular 14 - Standalone APIs, Animations, SSR Support, Typed Forms, TypeScript 4.7 and more
desc: The release of Angular 14 was just announced on June 2, 2022, and offers many exciting new features including Typed Forms, Standalone Components, Typescript 4.7 support, and more.

title: Building a Cloud-Native App using Angular/Ionic with Amplify, and Java/Quarkus with Copilot ECS
desc: Let's do things more complex. In my previous tutorial, I deployed a Java Quarkus native application using AWS Fargate. But now, we will be adding the frontend counterpart to that application that will be created using the Angular/Ionic in conjunction with the Amplify technology. The backend side will be the same, but we will be using the ECS Copilot tool to automate the Fargate cluster creation on ECS.

title: Angular Dependency Injection
desc: Objective: In this article, you will know dependency injection concept, custom dependency injection in Angular

title: Data Bindings In Angular
desc: Hi everyone, welcome to the second blog of the beginner series. Thank you for the amazing response to the first blog.

title: Why use OnPush in Angular? Not for performance...
desc: In this video, we discuss the less obvious benefit of OnPush change detection and that is that it helps you architect your applications better. We also look at a specific example of where using OnPush led me to creating significantly better code.

title: Angular — Preloading Lazy-loaded Modules
desc: Lazy loading is one of the techniques used to improve the performance by loading the modules whenever required instead of loading all modules on the initial load.

title: Custom Directive in Angular, Angular tutorial #10
desc: In this Angular tutorial, what directive and how we can make custom directive in Angular.

title: WebSocket Implementation in Angular
desc: The WebSocket API is an advanced technology that makes it possible to open a two-way interactive communication session between the user's browser and a server. With this API, we can send messages to a server and receive event-driven responses without having to poll the server for a reply.

title: Build Offline Ionic Angular 5 Applications
desc: In mobile apps, we have come across many conditions in which, the rendered data (from the server) is the same most of the time but is repeatedly fetched from the server. This data fetching every time from the server is useless and a huge waste of data bandwidth. Another similar situation where we can't even access the app is — when we call the sever with no network/internet then there will be NO_INTERNET error in the App.

title: Angular Forms
desc: If you started learning Angular from version 1 (AngularJs), maybe you will be more familiarized with configuring a clean Html to handle states and validations in the form. This approach is known as Template-Driven Forms.

title: Angular - RxJS - Operator mergeAll
desc: MergeAll is useful when you have a scenario to perform operations or searches by each item that is coming from the first Observable, so you are going to have one observable for each item. Let me illustrate this with an example to make it clear.

desc: In this article, we will create an Angular component that takes in some text from the user, and as the user presses the Enter key, we will store that value into a visual representation that looks like the picture below

title: Angular: Keeping track of the loading spinner states for multiple HTTP Requests in multiple components
desc: Adding a loading spinner to an Angular application is a topic I have implemented earlier considering just 1 component and 1 HTTP Request in the below story.

desc: With Angular 14 having just released recently, let us discuss how you can take advantage of some of the most popular tools in the JavaScript ecosystem to increase your efficiency and productivity when building Angular applications.

title: Angular Material Mobile App with Capacitor
desc: Learn to style your Angular web app with Angular Material, integrate a responsive sidenav component and build a native mobile app from your code with Capacitor!

title: Building a Realtime Chat Application Using Angular and Appwrite
desc: Appwrite is an open-source backend-as-a-service that provides developers with a core set of functionality needed to build any application with any stack. From database interactions to authentication, real-time updates, and more.

title: RxJS interop incompatibility: A tale as old as time
desc: The story of an interesting bug that will almost certainly only appear within our unique setup.

title: Getting Started with the Modular Firebase 9 Authentication in Angular
desc: In this tutorial, we are going to take a first look at Angular authentication using Firebase 9.0 Modular Imports. I show you how to install, set up, and integrate the latest version of the  Firebase SDK called Firebase 9. What we did was make use of the @angular/fire npm package to set up an authentication form that makes use of the Email/Password sign-in method in Firebase.

title: Angular 14 full course 2022 for beginner
desc: This Angular tutorial teaches you the fundamentals of Angular 14 and TypeScript. In this video, we will learn Angular 14 from scratch step by step to deploy the Angular app into firebase hosting.

title: Angular 14 — Introducing Standalone Components
desc: Angular 14 introduces the standalone component—a component not part of any ngModule that can be used with either other standalone or module-based components.

title: Learn RxJS Angular, RxJS pipe, async pipe, RxJS observables, BehaviorSubject, CombineLatest
desc: Learn RxJS Angular and it's most needed features: Async pipe, RxJS pipe, RxJS map, RxJS filter, BehaviorSubject and combineLatest. In RxJS we have hundreds of methods but here you will learn only what you need in everyday use. We will talk why async pipe is better than subscribe, how to transform streams with rxjs map, how to filter streams, create own streams using BehaviorSubject and how to combine stream for easier use with combineLatest.

title: Angular Material Jump Start
How to Create an Angular Barcode QR Code Scanning Library
desc: Previously, we created an Angular Barcode and QR Code Scanner. To make it reusable for other Angular applications, we can turn it into an Angular library. This article will show you the process of creating an Angular barcode QR code scanning library, as well as how to integrate it into your Angular application.

title: Engineering Scalable Angular Components| Alex Rickabaugh| EnterpriseNG 2021
desc: My talk gives architectural advice and tips/tricks for designing such large components in ways where the code for various features is decoupled, so consumers that don't use specific features don't pay for them in their bundles. Adopting these patterns may also increase maintainability in the long run.

title: Custom pipe in Angular, Angular Tutorial #9
desc: From this video you will learn how we can create custom pipe in Angular and how we can you that pipe in our application.

title: Pipes in Angular , Angular Tutorial #8
desc: You will learn how to use in built pipes in Angular such as uppercase, lowercase, titlecase, slice, number, percent, currency, date pipes.

title: RxJS tap() - Utility Operator to Handle Side-Effects in an Observable
desc: Senior Enterprise Software Engineer, Nick Landkamer shows how to use 'tap()' to access all three channels of an observable stream to run side-effects, log data, and handle errors. By using this utility operator, RxJS ensures that each function remains pure without the need for a transformation operator to observe the data stream.

title: S2E22 - Doguhan Uluca Tale: of a Turk in Tech
desc: In this episode we are exploring the origin and journey of an incredible member of the Angular community, Doguhan Uluca. He's a Technical Fellow at a company called Excella in Washington DC. He's also notably from Turkey. We'll explore his story and his journey into tech.

title: Angular 13 - 14 migration | Angular version migration | Angular update
desc: In this video you will learn how to update Angular version from 13 to 14 using Angular update guide.

title: Strategy Pattern in Angular with Injector
desc: Strategy is a behavioral design pattern that lets you define a family of algorithms, put each of them into a separate class, and make their objects interchangeable.

desc: For web applications, having a lot of similar GET APIs is normal, but creating them is repetitive and tedious for developers.

desc: Despite the fact that one type of emulation is being used in 99% of all cases we need to know of all available options to make better choices during the development.

title: Bizarre Angular template debugging technique no one really talks about
desc: Since Angular templates are actually transformed by the Angular compiler to JavaScript, this transformation gives us access to sourceMaps. This allows us to actually add breakpoints to our Angular templates!

title: Deploy Angular to Cloud Run
desc: Learn how to deploy an Angular application to Google Cloud Run. This lesson shows how to use the Cloud Build tool to automatically build and deploy your application on every push to Github.

title: Best practices for the JWT Interceptor in Angular
desc: This video shows you how to use interceptors in Angular, and how to create an interceptor for JWT token injection.

title: Angular - Use ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush
desc: Angular gives us an option to choose the ChangeDetectionStrategy of a component. By default, the value is Default. It's recommended to change that to OnPush strategy to maximize the performance.

title: #13 Angular Tutorial - Angular Developer Tools
Detect swipes with reactive programming
desc: In this article, we are going to build a library for swipe detection on touchscreen devices with help of a popular library RxJS that brings functional-reactive programming to the Javascript world. I would like to show you the power of reactive programming that provides the right tools to deal with event streams in a very elegant manner.

title: Reusable Component Pieces with ngTemplateOutlet
desc: ng-template, ng-container, and ngTemplateOutlet provide the ability to reuse content inside an Angular component. Understanding what's going on and how to use these methods allows a developer to build what they want without needing to duplicate parts of the template.

title: Create Web Components by using Google Lit, publish them on NPM and use them in React, Angular
desc: Web components are a set of technologies that allow us to create reusable HTML elements, in which all features are encapsulated within their code.

title: RxJS Observables, A Gentle Introduction
desc: For a long time I struggled to make head or tails of what are Observables, how to use them and how to apply them in Angular apps whilst following best patterns. I'll try to explain to the best of my understanding what I now know about Observables as I get to learn much more about them.
